intro: Pneumonanthe campestris, commonly known as the field lungwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Plantaginaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of oval, hairy leaves that form a dense cluster near the ground. The plant produces spikes of purple or pink tubular flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Pneumonanthe campestris is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
